SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo

Class MenuScreen

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.MenuScreen
public class MenuScreen extends Object
menu screen main display. displays the main menu, win screen and game over screen. includes buttons which start game, restart game and exit game. includes an interface to communicate with controller.java.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    MenuScreen.Listener
    listener interface to fetch data to pass to next level function of controller.java.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuScreen

      public MenuScreen(String levelName, int health)
      instantiates the menuscreen class by passing initial health and level name values. creates a new group and scene as well as images for the main, win and lose menu screen.
      Parameters:
      levelName - name of first level to be called when event occurs.
      health - initial user health value to be set for level instantiation.

  • Method Details

    • setMenuListener

      public void setMenuListener(MenuScreen.Listener listener)
      sets an implementing class as a listener of the interface.
      Parameters:
      listener - assigns as a listener to the implementing class.

    • getEnd

      public javafx.scene.Scene getEnd(boolean n)
      returns a scene of a win or lose screen. determined by its boolean n value. restart game takes user to first level. exit game exits the program. buttons manually positioned and styled.
      Parameters:
      n - determines whether a win or loss screen should be displayed.
      Returns:
      win or loss screen scene.

    • getStart

      public javafx.scene.Scene getStart()
      returns a scene of the main menu screen. start game take user to first level. exit game exits the program. buttons are manually positioned and styled.
      Returns:
      main menu screen scene.
